pkgmetadata.longdescription: Inference About Relationships from DNA Mixtures // Methods for inference about/under complex relationships using peak height data from DNA mixtures: the most basic example would be testing whether a contributor to a mixture is the father of a child of known genotype. This provides most of the functionality of the 'KinMix' package, but with some loss of efficiency and restriction on problem size, as the latter uses 'RHugin' as the Bayes net engine, while this package uses 'gRain'. The package implements the methods introduced in Green, P. J. and Mortera, J. (2017) doi:10.1016/j.fsigen.2017.02.001 and Green, P. J. and Mortera, J. (2021) doi:10.1111/rssc.12498.
